qas.question: What rating did 'Temple of Doom' receive?
What movie caused 'PG-13' to be created?

answers.text: the high level of violence in films targeted at younger audiences

qas.question: What was Spielberg's future wife's career?

plausible_answers.text: Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom

qas.question: Which is the least violent Indiana Jones movie?
In what year did the original Indiana Jones movie release?
In what year did Kate Capshaw start her acting career?
In what year did Kate Capshaw do her last movie?

context: His next directorial feature was the Raiders prequel <b6_0>Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom<b6_0/>. Teaming up once again with Lucas and Ford, the film was plagued with uncertainty for the material and script. This film and the Spielberg-produced <a2_0>Gremlins<a2_0/> led to the creation of the <b5_0>PG-13<b5_0/> rating due to <a3_0>the high level of violence in films targeted at younger audiences<a3_0/>. In spite of this, Temple of Doom is rated <a0_0>PG<a0_0/> by the MPAA, even though it is the darkest and, possibly, most violent Indy film. Nonetheless, the film was still a huge blockbuster hit in <a1_0><b7_0><b8_0><b9_0>1984<b9_0/><b8_0/><b7_0/><a1_0/>. It was on this project that Spielberg also met his future wife, <a4_0>actress<a4_0/> Kate Capshaw.
